overview_of_class: This course provides an introduction to selected musical cultures of the Western world from before 1600 by concentrating on music, its intellectual and cultural contexts, its creators, and its performance practices. Students will also be introduced to traditions of performing this music today and to tools for conducting research on music.
name: Western Music Cultures Before 1600
title: MUSIC MUSIC 214-0-20 Western Music Cultures Before 1600

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course provides an introduction to selected musical cultures of the Western world from before 1600 by concentrating on music, its intellectual and cultural contexts, its creators, and its performance practices. Students will also be introduced to traditions of performing this music today and to tools for conducting research on music.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Required for, and limited to, Undergraduates in the Bienen School of Music. Not open to Non-Music Majors.

subject: MUSIC
